meanings.definition: Having or expressing a desire or hope for something to happen.
meanings.sent1: She had a wishful smile on her face as she blew out the birthday candles.
meanings.sent2: It is wishful thinking to believe that all your dreams will come true without hard work.
meanings.sent3: His wishful thoughts about winning the lottery made him buy multiple tickets.
meanings.sent4: The wishful anticipation of the upcoming vacation kept her excited all week.
meanings.sent5: The child's wishful eyes gazed at the toy store display with longing.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or involving wishful thinking.
meanings.sent1: Her wishful imagination often led her to unrealistic expectations.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement made wishful promises that were too good to be true.
meanings.sent3: His wishful belief that he could fly like a superhero led to a humorous situation.
meanings.sent4: The wishful nature of his plans crumbled when faced with reality.
meanings.sent5: The wishful nature of the plan was evident in its lack of practicality.
